title: WeWork’s Bonds Are Tumbling as It Weighs Rescue Packages
text:
WeWork’s bond price has fallen to a record low on a report that it is considering an unconventional form of borrowing—with double-digit interest rates—to stave off a cash shortage that could hit as soon as next month.

The flexible-office-space manager is reportedly discussing two options to raise money. One would cede control of the company to its major investor, SoftBank Group (ticker: 9984.Japan). The other is a $5 billion financing package led by J.P. Morgan—and one with rather unconventional terms, as Bloomberg reported...
description: WeWork’s bond price has fallen to a record low on a report that it is considering an unconventional form of borrowing—with double-digit interest rates—to stave off a cash shortage that could hit as soon as next month.
